project.teaser: The overall goal of COMECT is to coordinate activities across Europe’s strategic adaptive platform trials (APTs) and cohort studies (CS) on infectious diseases (IDs) with epidemic or pandemic potential, by overseeing and facilitating dialogue, sharing of good practices...
project.title: COordination MEchanism for Cohorts and Trials

organization.legalName: ECRIN EUROPEAN CLINICAL RESEARCH INFRASTRUCTURE NETWORK

organization.shortName: NORWEGIAN INSTITUTE OF PUBLIC HEALTH NIPH

organization.legalName: INSTITUT NATIONAL DE LA SANTE ET DE LA RECHERCHE MEDICALE
STICHTING EUROPEAN CLINICAL RESEARCH ALLIANCE ON INFECTIOUS DISEASES

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: Pandemic preparedness and response: Sustaining established coordination mechanisms for European adaptive platform trials and/or for cohort networks

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

programme.title: Infectious Diseases, including poverty-related and neglected diseases

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: ToR and CDA for TCB
result.description: This deliverable will describe the mandate and objective of the TCB, with proceduresfor participation and decision making. confidentiality measures

result.title: White paper 1 on recommendations regarding enhanced harmonisation and innovation efforts
result.description: This white paper will present the (interim) recommendations of the working group on harmonisation and innovation

result.title: ToR and CDA for CCB
result.description: This deliverable will describe the mandate and objective of the CCB, and provide procedures for meeting participation and decision making and confidentiality measures

result.title: Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation plan
result.description: Description of communication tools, purpose and recipients

result.title: Report on the structural and operational changes of the JAAM
result.description: This plan will outline structural changes to the JAAM (including aim, operation and participation) needed to evolve scope andoperations

result.title: Charter for outbreak clinical research response
result.description: Define decision-making processes for timing, level, and content of clinical research response according to different levels of threats. This charter will be based on the capitalisation of similar mechanisms at national, European and international level.

result.title: Harmonisation and Innovation workplan
result.description: Operational workplan for the implementation of the working groups tasks

result.title: Learning from post-COVID-19 condition for epidemic preparedness: a variable catalogue for future post-acute infection syndromes

details.authors: Anna Górska, Lorenzo Maria Canziani, Eugenia Rinaldi, Zoi D. Pana, Sarah Beale, Francesca Bai, Bianca M. Boxma-de Klerk, Simeon de Bruijn, Daniele Donà, Miquel B. result.title: Governance charter for the Coordination Board (TCB, CCB and ORB)
result.description: This deliverable will describe the levels of collaboration in and outside the EU andbetween investigators and stakeholders

result.title: SOPs for alignment of APTs and CSs
result.description: This deliverable will suggest the appropriate information flow between these studies as ensure complementarity

details.authors: Jacques Demotes; Victoria Charlotte Simensen; Keiko Ueda; Sareema Javaid; Paula Garcia; Burç Aydin; John-Arne Røttingen

result.title: Charter for the ORB
result.description: An overview of the mandate and structure of the ORB

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
